title: 115_s1594
content: The "Protecting American Jobs Act" is the short title of the Act. It includes amendments to the National Labor Relations Act. The National Labor Relations Act is amended to clarify the duties of the General Counsel and Administrative Law Judges, limiting rulemaking authority to internal functions of the Board. The National Labor Relations Act is amended to clarify investigatory power and adjudicatory authority over unfair labor practice allegations. The National Labor Relations Act is amended to allow aggrieved persons to bring civil actions for relief in cases of violations, with the option to file in the district court where the violation occurred or in the United States District Court for the District of Columbia. No civil action may be brought if the person was not prevented from filing it. The National Labor Relations Act is amended to allow aggrieved persons to bring civil actions for relief in cases of violations. Amendments include striking subsections (c) through (k) and redesignating subsections (l) and (m) as subsections (c) and (d), respectively. Subsection (c) is modified to replace "charge" with "allegation" and make other editorial changes. The National Labor Relations Act is amended to allow civil actions for relief in cases of violations. Changes include replacing "charge" with "allegation" and making editorial adjustments in subsections. The National Labor Relations Act is amended to allow civil actions for relief in cases of violations. Amendments include redesignating subsections, updating references to section 9, and clarifying references to section 10. The National Labor Relations Board must review and update regulations within 6 months to implement the amendment to the National Labor Relations Act allowing civil actions for violations.
